paper.title: Open source software projects as virtual organisations: competency rallying for software development

author.org: School of Information Studies, Syracuse University, NY, USA#TAB#

paper.abstract: Contributes to the identification and testing of factors important for the success of open source software (OSS) projects. We present an analysis of OSS communities as virtual organisations, and apply Katzy and Crowstonu0027s (2000) competency rallying (CR) theory to the case of OSS development projects. CR theory suggests that project participants must develop necessary competencies, identify and understand market opportunities, marshal competencies to meet the opportunity and manage a short-term co-operative process. Using data collected from 7477 OSS projects hosted by the SourceForge system, we formulate and test a set of specific hypotheses derived from CR theory. The empirical data analysis supports the majority of these hypotheses, suggesting that CR theory provides a useful lens for studying OSS projects.
